DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate efficacy safety nasal high frequency oscillatory ventilation ( NHFOV ) preterms respiratory disease syndrome ( RDS ) extubation .
DOC.brief_title: Nasal High Frequency Oscillatory Versus Nasal Intermittent Positive Pressure Ventilation Neonate After Extubation
DOC.detailed_description: To low birth weight infant ( VLBW ) respiratory disease syndrome ( RDS ) need mechanical ventilation , early extubation may benefits.Early extubation may decrease ventilation-associated pneumonia ( VAP ) , sepsis decrease incidence severity bronchopulmonary dysplasia ( BPD ) .But often fail attempt extubation apnea , atelectasis , hypercapnia , hypoventilation illness . High frequency oscillatory ventilation benefit lung.Initial ventilation HFOV preterm RDS may reduce incidence BPD improve neurodevelopment.Compared HFOV conventional ventilation preterm infant show HFOV superior lung function 11 14 year age.Whether nasal high frequency oscillatory ventilation ( NHFOV ) also advantage non-invasive mode ? Null D M et al experiment preterm lamb , result suggest NHFOV may promote alveolarization.But clinical trial prove . The nasal intermittent positive pressure ventilation ( NIPPV ) group fail definition：1、 Fraction inspire oxygen ( FiO2 ) > 40 % 、MAP > 12 centimeter water column ( cm H2O ) , arterial oxygen saturation ( SaO2 ) < 90 % .2、significant abdominal distension.3、PaCO2 > 60millimeter mercury ( mmHg ) partial pressure arterial oxygen ( PaO2 ) < 45 millimeter mercury ( mmHg ) .4、severe apnea ( definition : > 6 episode require stimulation 6 hour require > 1 episode positive-pressure ventilation ) 5.potential hydrogen ( PH ) < 7.2 The The NHFOV group fail definition：1、FiO2 > 40 % 、MAP > 14 mbar , SaO2 < 90 % .2、significant abdominal distension.3、PaCO2 > 60millimeter mercury ( mmHg ) PaO2 < 45millimeter mercury ( mmHg ) .4、severe apnea 5.PH < 7.2 .
DOC.criteria: 1. birth weight > 1000g 2. gestational age > 28 week 3. respiratory distress syndrome need invasive ventilation 1. birth wight < 1000g 2. gestational age < 28 week 3. infant wiht abnormality upper low airway 4. infant contraindication noninvasive ventilation
